metadata.title: CVE-2020-2584 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:Server: Options). Supported versions that are affected are 5.7.28 and priorand 8.0.18 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows highprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to allMySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.4 (Confidentialityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-2584` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient21 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-client-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-router - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-server-core-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-source-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
mysql-testsuite-8.0 - 8.0.19-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-8.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.19-0ubuntu2').
